Author: *Wetmore, A.
Title: Food of American Phalaropes, Avocets, and Stilts
Journal: United States Department of Agriculture Bulletin
Common Name: Red Phalarope, Sea Geese, Whale Birds, Bowhead Birds
Food: Arthropoda, Crustacea (33.5%), Insecta, Coleoptera (27.3%), Diptera (22.7%), Pisces (6.8%)(mostly sculpins)
Benthic Inverts: 36 stomachs collected from May to November, mainly in August

Author: *Mannich, A. L. V.
Title: The Terrestrial Mammals and birds of North-east Greenland
Common Name: Red Phalarope, Sea Geese, Whale Birds, Bowhead Birds
Food: Arthropoda, Insecta, gnat larvae, vegetation remnants

Author: Bent, A. C.
Title: Life histories of North American shore birds: Part 1
Habitat: sea surface, floating seaweed, near whales and fish schools,
Benthic Inverts: *from Dover publications, 1967 reprinting of USNM Bull. 146

Author: *Brewster, W.
Title: The Birds of the Lake Umbagog Region of Maine

Author: Mackay, G. H.
Title: Notes on certain water birds in Massachusetts
Food: ? Arthropoda, ? Crustacea, red whale bait, brit (Krill?).

Author: *Wetmore, A.
Title: Food of American Phalaropes, Avocets, and Stilts
Journal: United States Department of Agriculture Bulletin
Observation: Arthropoda, Insecta, Diptera, flies, mosquito larvae (32.8%), Hemiptera (31.8%) including water boatmen and backswimmers, Coleoptera (16.5%), Odonata, dragonfly nymphs, Crustacea (9.3%), Chelicerata, Arachnida, Araneae, spiders, Annelida, Polychaeta, Mollusca, Pisces, vegetation, seeds
Food: 155 stomachs collected from May to October
